newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Stockpile sells aluminum to six companies.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Stockpile sells aluminum to six companies.

text.p: U.S. Defense National Stockpile Center said it sold 11,812 short tons of aluminum to six companies for $17,562,297.
VAW America bought 300 tons at $1,485 per ton.
Reynolds Metals Co bought 240 tons at $1,511 per ton and 1,000 tons at $1,486 per ton.
Metal Exchange Corp bought 500 tons at $1,482 per ton.
Glencore Ltd bought 551 tons at $1,497, 551 tons at $1,493, and 1,670 tons at $1,483.
Global Minerals and Metals bought 500 tons at $1,487, and 500 tons at $1,483.
Gerald Metals bought three lots of 2,000 tons at $1,491, $1,486, and $1,481 per ton respectively.
The next offering of Stockpile aluminum is June 3.
